cause.description:
This cause is as is depicted by Detective Slocks in his most revered exercise in free-verse entitled, "the Cause of Gauze." Please join and support this meaninful cause.
"Slocks's famous work on the Cause of Gauze serves us not as a mere description or aesthetic, but as a profound escort into a new, grander way of living for humanity. It is a compelling thought that such a magnificent concept as the Cause of Gauze came forth to the world from the confines of a jail cell. These modest and controversial beginnings serve only to reinforce the beauty of the conceptual framework of the cause and the forthrighteousness of it's author."
--Jacques Derrida
1. We must disturb the world less often with are prickly fingers.
2. There was jello in the fingerprints.
3. Chris didn't mean to steal the stamp.
4. Rachel didn't meant to steal the flashlight.
cause.mission: To serve as a gauze for our fellow man.
cause.name: The Cause of Gauze
